intro: Machaerium puberulum, commonly known as the silky machaerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, also known as the legume or bean family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pods that contain small, round seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Machaerium puberulum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along riverbanks.
